description.narrative: This project is closely related to other activities undertaken by RVO and the EKN of Tanzania and Kenia in the aquaculture sector. In 2013 FoodTech Africa-Kenya was set up through the FDOV programme (still operational) and since the beginning 2018 the lessons learned in Kenya are further expanded to Tanzania within the impact cluster Aquaculture. The working group meetings that are facilitated by this project are of utmost importance for the success and impact of the impact cluster. The project will be implemented in close collaboration with FoodtechAfrica in the period from 1 October 2019 – 31 December 2020.Objective:The working group intends to create a platform (Public and Private) for cooperation between Tanzania and the Netherlands in addressing issues that could facilitate and enable environment for aquaculture sector development as has also been agreed upon in the MoU signed between the Netherlands and Tanzanian government.Updated information, knowledge and sector progress will trigger actions to be taken by the authorities. This will also serve as support to the FoodTechAfrica impact cluster to understand recent development and give opportunity to air out issues that could be challenging at that particular time.As the different stakeholders in Tanzania are based in different locations, the working groups are expensive to organize. That is why this PSD toolkit project is developed to enable the Netherlands Embassy to invite the working group members to meet for at least 3 times during the remaining runtime of the impact cluster. In long term, this project will create an enabling environment for the further development of the aquaculture sector and private sector investments within the aquaculture value chain in Tanzania; at the same time it is in line with the Tanzanian national industrialization agenda.

participating-org.narrative: Netherlands embassy in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania

receiver-org.narrative: Netherlands embassy in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania
